thread.title: Father, son die in crash with each other
thread.title_full: Father, son die in crash with each other

title: Father, son die in crash with each other
text:
Use keywords to search content on this website Search Use keywords to search content on this website media_camera Jeffrey Brasher with his son Austin. Both were killed when Austin's father crashed head-on into his son's vehicle. Picture: Kristy Nelson Father and son killed in head-on crash with each other Ian Horswill, News Corp Australia Network February 20, 2017 4:52pm 
A FATHER and his son died in a head-on crash with each other. 
Jeffrey Morris Brasher, 50, who was driving a 2006 Ford pick-up smashed head-on with his 22-year-old son Austin Blaine Brasher’s Chevrolet pick-up, Al.com reported . 
Neither were wearing a seat belt and Alabama Law Enforcement said alcohol was a factor. 
Jeffrey Basher’s allegedly lost control of his vehicle and it careered into the fronty of his son’s pick-up on Fayette County 49 near the city of Winfield in Alabama , at 4.10am on Saturday local time. 
Jeffrey Basher died instantly. His son was pronounced dead five hours later in UAB Hospital in the state’s main city Birmingham. 
A distraught family member Jennifer Brasher posted on Facebook that the dad and son, who lived in nearby Bankston , “will forever” be her “guardian angels”. 
“I miss y’all so much already,” she wrote. 
She also posted a link to an article about the collision, asking: “Can this all be just a dream?” 
Pam Brasher Dennis also took to the social network to express her grief. 
“Our hearts are broken while our faith remains in Him. There are no words to describe the heartbreaking loss of losing both Jeff Brasher and Austin Brasher,” she posted. 
The investigation into the cause of the accident continues.
